intro: Capsella hanseatica, commonly known as the Baltic knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Capsella hanseatica is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
